subject: Learning
title: How Babies Learn Language
description: A quick win: understand How Babies Learn Language.

hook.text: A newborn can distinguish every sound in every language on Earth. By 12 months, they hear only their native tongue.

buildup.text: Babies are born as universal listeners. Through exposure, they specialize in the sounds of their native language.

discovery.text: By 8 months, babies track statistical patterns in speechâ€”noting which sounds frequently appear together.

twist.text: This statistical learning is so powerful that babies can segment words from speech before understanding any of them.

climax.text: Language acquisition starts months before the first word. Listening is the first act of learning.

punchline.text: Babies don't just hear language. They decode itâ€”months before they speak.

quiz.question: How do babies begin to learn language before speaking?
options: They track statistical patterns in speech to identify word boundaries
They memorize words from picture books
Language learning only begins when babies start talking
